course_title: Independent Research: Teach. Methodology Eng. Lang.
class_notes:
Topic of Study: Students will study texts, discuss, and observe classes designated for English Language Learners (ELLs) in order to acquire knowledge about the English learning and instructional process. Various teaching techniques will be modelled during class sessions.


Objectives/Learning Outcomes: 
Through this directed study, the student will be able to:
(1) Explain the first and second language acquisition process.
(2) Develop knowledge of multiple instructional methods, techniques, styles, and strategies for teaching ELL students.
(3) Understand and recognize ELL students in terms of their background, learning styles, and language competence.
course_description:
Students conduct independent research in support of their own research agenda or
question with guidance from a faculty member. Permission of the department and a
supervising faculty member is required.
